title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
desc: The inaugural book in the "Harry Potter" series, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, ushers readers into the life of Harry Potter as he turns eleven. Born to a renowned magical couple, Harry finds himself an orphan, left in the care of his Aunt Petunia and Uncle Vernon Dursley, along with their son Dudley. Through these beginnings, the story introduces themes of identity, belonging, and the unseen world of magic.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
desc: The second book in the "Harry Potter" series, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, follows Harry's return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. As he navigates his second year, he uncovers a dark secret hidden within the school, leading to thrilling adventures and deepening friendships. The book explores themes of bravery, loyalty, and the importance of standing up against prejudice.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
desc: In the third installment of the "Harry Potter" series, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Harry returns to Hogwarts for his third year, where he learns about the mysterious Sirius Black, an escaped prisoner believed to be after him. As Harry uncovers the truth about his past and the events surrounding his parents' deaths, he faces new challenges and deepens his understanding of friendship and loyalty.
